SUMMARY: sn-Glycerol-3-phosphate repressor, GlpR, acts as repressor of glycerol-3-phosphate regulon, which is organized in different operons [3316209, 825019, 1556120, 9179845, 1400248, 1372899, 8955388]. This regulator is part of glpEGR operon, yet it can also be constitutively expressed as an independent ARRAY(0x1577a08) transcription unit [9524241, 3881401]. In addition, operons regulated are induced when Escherichia coli is grown in presence of inductor, glycerol, or glycerol-3-phosphate ARRAY(0x15b6280) , and absence of glucose [825019]. In absence of inductor, this repressor binds in tandem to inverted repeat sequences that consist of 20-nucleotide-long DNA target sites [8157609, 1556120, 825019]. Binding of GlpR to DNA is diminished in presence of inducers glycerol or G3P. GlpR belongs to DeoR family of transcriptional regulators [8955387]. Accordingly, this transcriptional repressor family protein is composed of two domains: a conserved N-terminal domain which contains DNA-binding region, and carboxy-terminal domain, which is involved in oligomerization and binding of inducer [8955387]. Resequencing of multiple isolates of MG1655 strain has identified several genetic variations compared to reference sequence, including a 1-bp deletion in glpR in strain ATCC700926 [22081388]. summarizes se sequence differences.
